game_description: You will learn a historic craft by completing and experimenting with challenges and tacit puzzles presented in each craft Master the tacit skills of historic crafts. Stay motivated to complete and experiment with old crafts challenges. Historical objects are 1:1 models based on 3D photogrammetry and thorough studies by historians. Textures on these objects are prioritized to achieve authenticity and portray beautiful craftmanship. The experience emphasises historical accuracy so it can be used for vanicular education and historical dissemination. Getting started is easy! Brief tutorials teach you how to interact with objects and the world. Continuous locomotion and teleporting is supported. The experience will be supported on all Oculus VR headsets.
review_1: This is definitely a 5 star game in my opinion and I would recommend this game to anyone but the game is way too short
review_2: The flintlock is top tier. Honestly one of the best VR guns I’ve ever had an experience with. However there are three extra parts of this game that say they are coming soon. I’m cool with that too. But I downloaded this and played it over a year ago definitely longer and no additional content has been released or teased to my knowledge. It’s upsetting to see because VR is such a good Avenue for historical experiences which isn’t been used by anyone.

review_4: The game was solid in the reload and role play of a civil war duel but I feel like the game has been abandoned after so little content even though it’s been out so long
review_5: The physics and movement of the gun and player felt smooth, it is great if you want to shoot and reload an old flintlock. Overall the game is awesome despite so little content, I hope there will be more!
